recipe.title: Sesame Wonton Triangles with Smoked Salmon and Wasabi
ingredients: 1/4 cup plus 1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil (such as Asian)
Daikon radish sprouts or other small sprouts
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk 1/4 cup oil and egg white in small bowl to blend. Place wonton wrappers in single layer on work surface; brush with some of oil mixture and sprinkle with half of seeds. Fold diagonally in half. Brush with more oil mixture; sprinkle with remaining seeds. Cut each into 2 triangles. Place on baking sheet. Bake until golden, about 13 minutes. Cool.

Whisk vinegar, chives, wasabi, ginger, and 1/2 teaspoon oil in bowl. Cover each wonton with 1 salmon slice, then drizzle with wasabi mixture. Top salmon with sprouts, then fold salmon over sprouts. Top with more sprouts.
Found in the Asian foods section of supermarkets and at Japanese markets.
